title: Why you should get vaccinated against the seasonal flu anyway, despite H1N1
author: Oracknows
description: Even with the H1N1 pandemic flu going around you should still be vaccinated against the seasonal flu. revere has the details.
cleaned_text: Even with the H1N1 pandemic flu going around you should still be vaccinated against the seasonal flu. [revere has the details](http://scienceblogs.com/effectmeasure/2009/09/seasonal_flu_why_i_got_vaccina.php). I guess that means [Dr. Doug Bremner must think that revere is an idiot](http://www.beforeyoutakethatpill.com/index.php/2009/01/28/flu-shots-are-still-for-idiots-2/). After all, Bremner tells us that the flu vaccine is all a [plot for big pharma to make money](http://www.beforeyoutakethatpill.com/index.php/2009/01/29/no-vaccines-for-me-please-but-thanks-anyway/), don't you know? Subtlety and weighing of risk-benefit ratios in a manner that doesn't turn into an anti-big pharma rant is beyond him. Fortunately it is not [beyond revere](http://scienceblogs.com/effectmeasure/2009/09/seasonal_flu_why_i_got_vaccina.php): The truth is this. No one knows what's going to happen. We're all guessing. But in my estimation, the risk-benefit calculation for vaccine side-effects and flu is so markedly in favor of the vaccine that I made the decision to get vaccinated and that's what I'd advise others, too. How confident am I? I'm confident it is the most rational thing to do given what we know. Exactly. I [may not always agree with revere](http://scienceblogs.com/insolence/2009/08/effect_measure_on_science-based_medicine.php) on a lot of things, but I know he's not an idiot. I'd love to see Bremner try to counter the arguments of a highly respected senior epidemiologist who can calmly discuss the pros and cons of flu vaccines from a scientific and practical standpoint based on evidence. Bremner points to " [experts](http://www.beforeyoutakethatpill.com/index.php/2009/01/28/flu-shots-are-still-for-idiots-2/)" who say that vaccination against the seasonal flu is a waste of money and time, but here's one expert I bet that Bremner can't refute. I won't hold my breath waiting for him to try, though. It's so much easier just to say that you're an idiot if you get vaccinated.
